text: hi my name is Drew Pinsky and I make
daily travel videos my career in travel
started off five years ago when I moved
to Korea to teach English from day one
in Seoul I started a travel blog I
worked really hard on it and it evolved
into being a social media creator and
now I focus on making daily travel
videos I strive to inspire young adults
to travel and step outside their comfort
zone while attempting to reach my goal
of visiting every country in the world
I have only 60 left my job seems easy
from the outside visit a place take a
few videos and click publish but it's a
lot more work than you think the videos
that you watch don't just magically
appear on your newsfeed or else everyone
would make them so driving a faster
grounder right now and I'm editing some
videos in the car each video takes a lot
of time to plan create and execute
pretty much one full day of work equals
one video and by full day I'm talking 7
a.m. to 11 p.m. yes I am always
traveling to cool places like right here
in Somaliland
but I am on my computer working more
hours of the day than I am not my brain
is running 24/7 whether I'm in the
shower on an airplane or laying in bed
here is what an average day in my life
looks like behind the scene 6:30 a.m.
wake up in the new country 6:30 to 8:00
a.m. shower eat breakfast respond to
emails facebook comments snapchat
messages
insta comments and tweets FaceTime my
girlfriend if she's not with me 8 to 10
a.m. do research on the place I'm
visiting start writing the script on my
iPhone notepad and keep revising it
scout out places activities and events
to shoot for the day and recruit locals
to take me around or be featured in my
video this planning process often
happens the night before as well 10 a.m.
to 3 p.m.
going out exploring and shooting
everything I can
using my Lumix G H 5 that was amazing
except the line
gopu here a session four and DJI spark
also snapchatting and instagramming
everything on my iphone eating lunch at
some point and then shooting some more 3
p.m. to 7 p.m. go back to my hotel and
dub all footage on this lazy 2 terabyte
external hard drive which I now have to
oh do the voiceover under bed sheets for
sound proof then throw everything into
Adobe Premiere Pro to start editing an
average video takes me four to five
hours to edit as I need to pull select
type out the text match the clip to the
words and find catchy songs 7 to 7:30
p.m.
eat dinner 7:30 to 9:00 p.m. finish
editing if I have more exports a video
come up with a catchy title make a nice
cover photo and think of a creative
description that will make you want to
watch it 9:00 to 10:00 p.m. upload the
video to Facebook and sometimes YouTube
I may schedule them out depending on
time zones if I'm in a remote area with
poor Wi-Fi like I was in most of Africa
then I wait hours and hours for the
video to upload 10 p.m. to 12 a.m.
promote the video across my social media
channels answering as many comments as I
can and then hit the whiteboard for
tomorrow's video 12 a.m. to 6:30 a.m.
sweet time 6:30 a.m. wake up and repeat
the process
I haven't even discussed the time I
spend posting on other social media
channels dealing with travel delays at
the Mongolia pitching myself to sponsors
negotiating contract updating my website
etc I usually do these first thing in
the morning or last thing before I sweep
or on a rare day off from making a video
lastly I'm not telling you all this to
complain because I truly love my job I
couldn't imagine doing anything else
but I just want to show you how many
hours of dedication and time it takes me
every day to make videos and now you may
finally understand that making videos is
my full-time job
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
